abilities.title: Second Wind
abilities.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.

abilities.title: Action Surge
abilities.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action.

abilities.title: Improved Critical
abilities.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

abilities.title: Remarkable Athlete
abilities.description: Starting at 7th level, you can add half your proficiency bonus (round up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn’t already use your proficiency bonus.

abilities.title: Combat Superiority
abilities.description: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

abilities.title: Student of War
abilities.description: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

abilities.title: Arcane Recovery
abilities.description: Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wizard level (rounded up).

abilities.title: Spellcasting
abilities.description: You have learned to cast spells from the wizard spell list.

abilities.title: Sculpt Spells
abilities.description: When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws.

abilities.title: Potent Cantrip
abilities.description: Starting at 6th level, your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that succeed on saving throws. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect.

abilities.title: Grim Harvest
abilities.description: Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to twice the spell’s level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the necromancy school.

abilities.title: Undead Thralls
abilities.description: At 6th level, you add the animate dead spell to your spellbook. When you cast it, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones, creating an extra undead servant.
